pages.text: Sponges are basal animals that are multicellular organisms with bodies full of pores which allows water to circulate through it. They typically grow on the ocean floor and are generally filter feeders, feeding by filtering out food particles from the water that flows through them. Sponges are possibly the oldest continuously-existing family of macroscopic life on the planet, having more or less evolved into recognisable forms by the Ediacaran period.
